snippet: Malware may be the digital equivalent of bedbugs: suddenly ubiquitous, hard to treat and a real menace for those infested. That might explain why a post about a psychologist's fight with Google over an infected Web site stoked such impassioned...
abstract: Malware may be the digital equivalent of bedbugs: suddenly ubiquitous, hard to treat and a real menace for those infested. That might explain why a post about a psychologist's fight with Google over an infected Web site stoked such impassioned responses.

headline.main: Readers and Experts Weigh In on a Site Owner vs. Google
